intro: Anisodus acutangulus var. acutangulus, commonly known as the Chinese horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers with prominent, horn-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is known for its medicinal properties. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms during the summer months. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native range.
